trans-unit.source: Represents a 3x3 affine transformation matrix used for transformations in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] space.
A 3x3 matrix is used for transformations in a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_2d](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-2d-md.md)] x-y plane.
Affine transformation matrices can be multiplied to form any number of linear transformations, such as rotation and skew (shear), followed by translation.
An affine transformation matrix has its final column equal to (0, 0, 1), so only the members in the first two columns need to be specified.
Note that vectors are expressed as row-vectors, not column vectors.

A [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] Matrix is stored using row-major order and has the following structure: |||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>|1| The members in the last row, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>, represent translation values.

In methods and properties, the transformation matrix is usually specified as a vector with only six members, as follows: (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>) Although you can use a Matrix structure directly to translate individual points, or with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MatrixTransform> to transform objects, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] also provides a set of classes that enable you to transform objects without working directly with matrices: <xref:System.Windows.Media.RotateTransform>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.ScaleTransform>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.SkewTransform>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.TranslateTransform>.
## XAML Attribute Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values *m11* The value in the first row and first column of this Matrix.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A> property.
*m12* <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName> The value in the first row and second column.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A> property.
*m21* <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName> The value in the second row and first column.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A> property.
*m22* <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName> The value in the second row and second column.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A> property.
*offsetX* <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName> The value in the third row and third column.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A> property.
*offsetY* <xref:System.Double?displayProperty=fullName> The value in the third row and second column.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11*> coefficient.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12*> coefficient.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21*> coefficient.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22*> coefficient.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX*> coefficient.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY*> coefficient.
Appends the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
This operation is the same as multiplying this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure by the parameter `matrix`.

Matrix multiplication is not commutative, though, so this operation is not the same as multiplying the parameter `matrix` by this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure; that is, (this * `matrix`) is not the same as (`matrix` \* this).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to append to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
Gets the determinant of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The determinant of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified <xref:System.Object> is a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure that is identical to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Object> to compare.
if o is a structure that is identical to this structure; otherwise, .
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure is identical to this instance.
The instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> to compare to this instance.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if instances are equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structures are identical.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to compare.
if matrix1 and matrix2 are identical; otherwise, .
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The hash code for this instance.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure is invertible.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> has an inverse; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets an identity <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
An identity matrix has a value of 1 in coefficients [1,1],[2,2],[3,3] and a value of 0 in the rest of the coefficients.

This correlates to setting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A> to 1 and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A> to 0.

In an affine matrix, which is the implementation that [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] uses for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>, structure, coefficients [3,1],[3,2],[3.3] are implied to always have the values 0,0,1 respectively.

|||| |-|-|-| |1|0|0| |0|1|0| |0|0|1| For an identity matrix, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.ToString%2A> method returns the string "Identity" instead of the coefficients of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.
An identity matrix.
Inverts this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure is not invertible.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure is an identity matrix.
An identity matrix has a value of 1 in coefficients [1,1],[2,2],[3,3] and a value of 0 in the rest of the coefficients.

This correlates to setting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A> to 1 and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A> to 0.

In an affine matrix, which is the implementation that [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] uses for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure, coefficients [3,1],[3,2],[3.3] are implied to always have the values 0,0,1 respectively.

|||| |-|-|-| |1|0|0| |0|1|0| |0|0|1| For an identity matrix, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.ToString%2A> method returns the string "Identity", instead of the coefficients of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure is an identity matrix; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the first row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The value of the first row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The default value is 1.
Gets or sets the value of the first row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The following table shows the layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

|||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|M12|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>|1|
The value of the first row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The default value is 0.
Gets or sets the value of the second row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The following table shows the layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

|||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>|0| |M21|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>|1|
The value of the second row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The default value is 0.
Gets or sets the value of the second row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The following table shows the layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure.

|||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>|M22|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>|1|
The value of the second row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The default value is 1.
Multiplies a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure by another <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
Matrix multiplication is not commutative.
Multiplying `trans1` by `trans2` is not the same as multiplying `trans2` by `trans1`.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to multiply.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to multiply.
The result of multiplying trans1 by trans2.
Gets or sets the value of the third row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The OffsetX property is so named because it specifies the amount to translate the coordinate space along the x-axis.
The following table shows the layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

|||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>|0| |OffsetX|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A>|1|
The value of the third row and first column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The default value is 0.
Gets or sets the value of the third row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The OffsetY property is so named because it specifies the amount to translate the coordinate space along the y-axis.
The following table shows the layout of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.

|||| |-|-|-| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>|<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>|OffsetY|1|
The value of the third row and second column of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The default value is 0.
Determines whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structures are identical.

The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to compare.
if matrix1 and matrix2 are identical; otherwise, .
Determines whether the two specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structures are not identical.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to compare.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to compare.
if matrix1 and matrix2 are not identical; otherwise, .
Multiplies a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure by another <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
Matrix multiplication is not commutative.
Multiplying `trans1` by `trans2` is not the same as multiplying `trans2` by `trans1`.
The first <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to multiply.
The second <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to multiply.
The result of multiplying trans1 by trans2.
Converts a <xref:System.String> representation of a matrix into the equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The <xref:System.String> representation of the matrix.
The equivalent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
Prepends the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure onto this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure to prepend to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
Applies a rotation of the specified angle about the origin of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The angle of rotation.
Rotates this matrix about the specified point.
The angle, in degrees, by which to rotate this matrix.
The x-coordinate of the point about which to rotate this matrix.
The y-coordinate of the point about which to rotate this matrix.
Prepends a rotation of the specified angle at the specified point to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The rotation angle, in degrees.
The x-coordinate of the rotation center.
The y-coordinate of the rotation center.
Prepends a rotation of the specified angle to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The angle of rotation to prepend.
Appends the specified scale vector to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The value by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the x-axis.
The value by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the y-axis.
Scales this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> by the specified amount about the specified point.
The amount by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the x-axis.
The amount by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the y-axis.
The x-coordinate of the scale operation's center point.
The y-coordinate of the scale operation's center point.
Prepends the specified scale about the specified point of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The x-axis scale factor.
The y-axis scale factor.
The x-coordinate of the point about which the scale operation is performed.
The y-coordinate of the point about which the scale operation is performed.
Prepends the specified scale vector to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The value by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure along the x-axis.
The value by which to scale this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure along the y-axis.
Changes this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure into an identity matrix.
An identity matrix has a value of 1 in coefficients [1,1],[2,2],[3,3] and a value of 0 in the rest of the coefficients.

This correlates to setting <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22%2A> to 1 and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY%2A> to 0.

In an affine matrix, which is the implementation that [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] uses for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure, coefficients [3,1],[3,2],[3.3] are implied to always have the values 0,0,1 respectively.

|||| |-|-|-| |1|0|0| |0|1|0| |0|0|1| For an identity matrix, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.ToString%2A> method returns the string "Identity", instead of the coefficients of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix>.
Appends a skew of the specified degrees in the x and y dimensions to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The angle in the x dimension by which to skew this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The angle in the y dimension by which to skew this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
Prepends a skew of the specified degrees in the x and y dimensions to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The angle in the x dimension by which to skew this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The angle in the y dimension by which to skew this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
Formats the value of the current instance using the specified format.
The format to use.

-or- A null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.
The provider to use to format the value.

-or- A null reference (<xref uid="langword_csharp_Nothing" name="Nothing" href=""></xref> in Visual Basic) to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
The value of the current instance in the specified format.
Creates a <xref:System.String> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
If this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> is an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.Identity%2A> matrix, the string "Identity" is returned.

A <xref:System.String> containing the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY*> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
Creates a <xref:System.String> representation of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure with culture-specific formatting information.
If this <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix> structure is an identity matrix, the string "Identity" is returned.
The culture-specific formatting information.

A <xref:System.String> containing the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M11*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M12*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M21*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.M22*>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetX*>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Matrix.OffsetY*> values of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
Transforms the specified point by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> and returns the result.
The point to transform.
The result of transforming point by this .
Transforms the specified points by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The points to transform.
The original points in the array are replaced by their transformed values.
Transforms the specified vector by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The vector to transform.
The result of transforming vector by this .
Transforms the specified vectors by this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref>.
The vectors to transform.
The original vectors in the array are replaced by their transformed values.
Appends a translation of the specified offsets to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
The amount to offset this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the x-axis.
The amount to offset this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the y-axis.
Prepends a translation of the specified offsets to this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> structure.
In a composite transformation, the order of individual transformations is important.
For example, if you first rotate, then scale, then translate, you get a different result than if you first translate, then rotate, then scale.
One reason order is significant is that transformations like rotation and scaling are done with respect to the origin of the coordinate system.
Scaling an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than scaling an object that has been moved away from the origin.
Similarly, rotating an object that is centered at the origin produces a different result than rotating an object that has been moved away from the origin.
The amount to offset this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the x-axis.
The amount to offset this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Matrix"></xref> along the y-axis.
